column2: Silicon Valley Bank serves some of the most innovative companies in the world. Our clients are forward thinkers. True believers. Optimists. Inspired by them, we're changing the face of banking. Our clients have redefined products in many areas of the global economy, and every day we power their ability to do so. We need leaders with the same can-do attitude as our clients. We're looking for creative thinkers who want to challenge the status quo and create a truly seamless digital banking experience on a global scale.   As the Engineering Manager for DevSecOps & Platform Engineering, you will play a crucial role in overseeing a team of highly skilled DevSecOps engineers, DevOps engineers, and developers focused on tool development. This role requires a blend of hands-on technical expertise, leadership capabilities, and a deep understanding and experience of secured SDLC, application development, test automation, CI/CD pipelines, security scanning, and on-prem/cloud infrastructure. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the seamless delivery of secure, scalable, and efficient software products. Primary Responsibilities: Responsible for overall Infrastructure Architecture and evolution of next-gen platforms. Ideal candidates will research the existing products and recommend solutions to run workloads in the futuristic Infrastructure Architecture landscape. Conduct Infrastructure as Code (IaC) reviews, automate, and deploy Cloud Infrastructure. Identify code vulnerabilities and Release Management bottlenecks and recommend solutions to improve the overall quality and Release Management of the systems. Create and maintain technical documentation, including architecture diagrams, design documents, and operational procedures for High Availability and Disaster Recovery scenarios. Build Automation for repeatable DevSecOps tasks and help with improving Software Engineers productivity. Thought Leadership around Shift Left (Quality, Security, OSS use, Release Management Engineering) & Shift Right (Chaos Engineering) and increasing the adoption of the eCommerce Platform. Help engineers develop their careers, assigning them to work tailored to their skill levels, long-term skill development, and work styles. Partner across engineering and management teams to create a positive work environment, and set clear expectations and accountability. Expand the team with SVBs values in mind. Drive to learn new things and go above and beyond the call of duty. Key Qualifications: Knowledge At least 3+ years of technical management experience in DevSecOps space and preferably in the Finance business domain Must have proven experience in managing teams of at least 10 to15 resources Solid understanding of Software Development Methodologies, DevOps principles, and Agile practices. Proficiency in DevOps Platforms (Gitlab, Jenkins), cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure), and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes). Knowledge of programming languages commonly used in DevOps environments (Java, Groovy, Python, Bash, PowerShell) and experience with automation tools (Ansible, Terraform). Familiarity with security tools and technologies such as vulnerability scanners, security information, and event management platforms and experience implementing controls to ensure compliance. Working knowledge of security principles, best practices, and standards (e.g., OWASP Top 10, NIST Cybersecurity Framework). Understanding of threat modeling, risk assessment, and vulnerability management. Ability to stay updated on emerging security threats and trends in the cybersecurity landscape. Strong project management skills with the ability to lead and coordinate cross-functional teams. Experience in planning, prioritizing, and executing projects within scope, schedule, and budget constraints. Leadership and Team Management Skills Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey technical concepts to stakeholders. Strong analytical, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships and foster collaboration between development, operations, and security teams. Experience in analyzing data and metrics to derive insights and make data-driven decisions. Experience in facilitating meetings, workshops, and training sessions to promote knowledge sharing and consensus building. Willingness to continuously learn and adapt to new technologies, methodologies, and industry trends. Ability to quickly grasp and apply new concepts and technologies to address evolving security challenges. Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate team members towards common goals. Experience in coaching, mentoring, and developing team members to enhance their skills and capabilities. Ability to provide constructive feedback and resolve conflicts effectively within the team.

column2: About the Role: As a Cloud Expert, assisting client in execution of smart meter works under RDSS scheme. Coordination with multiple stake holders like Implementing agency, Discom and Nodal agencies. Smooth and successful completion of the assignment project and task. A career within Application and Emerging Technology services, will provide you with a unique opportunity to help our clients identify and prioritize emerging technologies that can help solve their business problems. We help clients design approaches to integrate new technologies, skills, and processes so they can get the most out of their technology investment and drive business results and innovation B. List down the detailed set of expectations from the role: Coordination with the client and maintaining good relationship with them. Assisting client in implementation of Smart meter works under RDSS scheme. Proven experience with major cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, Oracle or Google Cloud Platform. Strong understanding of cloud computing principles, including infrastructure as code, containerization, micro services, and server less computing. Experience with cloud automation and orchestration tools. Knowledge of cloud security best practices and compliance standards. Certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Azure Solutions Architect Expert, or Google Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams would be considered on priority. Their job responsibilities include keeping track of cloud activities, developing, and moving applications to the cloud, and specifying computing demands. They also provide advice on how to deal with high-risk situations. Assisting in developing a well-informed cloud approach and monitoring the transition. Assist with infrastructure migration strategies, such as mass application transfers to the cloud. Assist in translating project-specific requirements into a cloud structure that meets those requirements, as well as taking into account the projects resource use and scalability requirements. Keeping track of how much cloud space is being used and ensuring that the system is running smoothly. Performing activities such as deployment, maintenance, monitoring, and management inside the cloud framework that has been created. Working with corporate clients to understand their requirements and put in place cloud solutions to satisfy those requirements. Conducting migrations to transfer tools and other aspects into the cloud, as needed. Collaborate with internal teams and external partners to identify and address emerging technologies risks and threats. Manage a team of professionals, providing technical guidance and support on emerging technologies issues. Develop and deliver training and awareness sessions for organization employees on emerging technologies best practices. Collaborate with international organizations and agencies on emerging technologies issues. Monitor and evaluate the program's effectiveness and impact and make adjustments as necessary. Support during Project Implementation & Management Ability to liaison with multiple stakeholders including management, ecosystem partners, vendors etc. Status reporting and monitoring Analysis/Evaluation of technical documents of the project  Quality management Knowledge management Project Delivery Ensure successful client delivery. Assure the client for best use of project disciplines and approaches. C.   Required   skill   set Over 6+ years of experience in in supporting design and implementation support for deployment of IT hardware and supporting hosting services on cloud for standard software or Experience in security audits & risk mitigation of IT systems, designing and implementing Cyber Security solutions. Excellent communication skill and proficiency in MS word/PPT/Excel. D. Education and Experience Degree in engineering / IT/ Computer Applications from a recognized university.  E.   Work   Location Uttar Pradesh (Varanasi or Agra) & may be required to travel anywhere in India. F. Remuneration Structure On roll/Contractual

column1: Data Engineer - Alteryx  : F2F Drive : 18th May : Bhubaneswar
column2: F2F Drive : Data Engineer - Snowflake : 18th May Location : Bhubaneswar Role : Full Time Client : Insurance POC - Subhalaxmi Swain Mob - 8144503880   Data Engineer  Alteryx Role Overview:  We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Alteryx Server Admin to join our organization. As an Alteryx Server Admin, you will be responsible for the efficient administration and maintenance of the Alteryx Server platform. Your goal will be to ensure the smooth operation of the platform, optimize its performance, and provide technical support to users. You will work closely with the IT team and stakeholders across various departments to meet the organization's data analytics and business intelligence needs. Roles and Responsibilities: Administer and maintain the Alteryx Server platform to ensure its optimal availability, performance, and security.  Install, configure, and upgrade Alteryx Server software and associated tools. Monitor system health and performance, proactively identifying and addressing any issues or bottlenecks that may arise. Collaborate with the IT team to implement backup and disaster recovery strategies for Alteryx Server. Work closely with Alteryx Designer users, assisting them in troubleshooting and resolving any technical issues. Collaborating with database administrators and IT teams to ensure smooth integration and performance. Implementing and enforcing server governance and compliance. Develop and maintain documentation related to Alteryx Server administration, including standard operating procedures, technical guides, and policies. Stay up-to-date with the latest developments and best practices in Alteryx Server administration, and make recommendations for continuous improvements. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data analytics and business intelligence requirements, and implement solutions using Alteryx Server as needed. Support and guide end-users in accessing and utilizing the Alteryx Server platform effectively and efficiently. Coordinate and conduct training sessions and workshops for users to enhance their understanding and proficiency in Alteryx Server. Collaborate with the IT team in ensuring the integration of Alteryx Server with other relevant systems and tools, such as databases and data lakes. Skills and Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. Proven experience as an Alteryx Server Admin or in a similar role. Strong knowledge of Alteryx Server administration, configuration, and maintenance. Familiarity with Alteryx Designer, including workflows and predictive analytics tools. Proficient in scripting languages, such as Python and PowerShell, for automation and customization purposes. Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills related to Alteryx Server and associated tools. Knowledge of data analytics and business intelligence concepts, tools, and techniques. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with users and stakeholders. Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a dynamic environment. Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality results. Ability to learn new technologies and tools quickly, keeping up with the latest trends and best practices in the field of data analytics.

A preferred advisor to leading Fortune 500 brands,  Nisum enables clients to achieve direct business growth by building the advanced technology they need to reach end customers in today s world,  with immersive and seamless experiences across digital and physical channels.          What you'll do        You ll be joining the infrastructure team in our Clearwater office,  supporting both production and back office environments. Nisum is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we are proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity and inclusion in the workplace.
